Author: Moderator
Message: Welcome kite552.

Author: kite552
Message: Hello!

Author: Moderator
Message: Thank you for participating in this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the next posts, I'll be going over the rules of the "game" you're about to play.

Author: Moderator
Message: Once I'll be done, I'll ask you if you've understood the rules, and if you haven't I'll explain them in different words.

Author: Moderator
Message: You're about to talk to Andrew. Andrew is a fictive character that has been completely created for the purpose of this study.

Author: Moderator
Message: You'll be talking to him twice.

Author: Moderator
Message: The only difference between the two conversations you'll have with him, is that in one of them Andrew will be played by a real human.

Author: Moderator
Message: In the other, it will be played by an Artificial Intelligence we are developing.

Author: Moderator
Message: We will call the Human and the Artificial Intelligence the Actors.

Author: Moderator
Message: The order in which you'll be talking to each Actor is random.

Author: Moderator
Message: You will not be talking twice with the same Actor.

Author: Moderator
Message: Both the Artificial Intelligence and the Human will try to portray the same Andrew in the most convincing way they can.

Author: Moderator
Message: Your goal is simple. After talking to the two actors, you'll have to guess which one was the Artificial Intelligence and which one was the Human.

Author: Moderator
Message: Whenever you have made your decision, you are able to stop the conversation.

Author: Moderator
Message: Each conversation will last for 15 minutes maximum if you do not decide to stop it before.

Author: Moderator
Message: Please, keep your posts to text only (No smileys, no links... etc)

Author: Moderator
Message: Do not type more than one post per answer.

Author: Moderator
Message: Do you understand the rules and what you have to do?

Author: kite552
Message: Yes, with the only question of what will the conversation be about? Or if a topic will be provided?

Author: Moderator
Message: Any topic can be used. It's completely free. Up to you to find ways to figure out which is which.

Author: kite552
Message: Alright, then yes I understand.

Author: Moderator
Message: Good. Andrew will start the conversation. The 15 minutes will start after your answer.

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: kite552
Message: Hello there, it is nice to meet you.

Author: Andrew
Message: It's nice to meet you too. How are you doing?

Author: kite552
Message: Just enjoying my day out of the office.

Author: Andrew
Message: Nice! What do you do for work?

Author: kite552
Message: I am a Service Desk Analyst, work answering the phone for people with low level computer issues.

Author: Andrew
Message: That sounds pretty useful. It also sounds kind of tiring. Some people can be a pain.

Author: kite552
Message: That is the understatement of the year, but I have to say it isn't as bad thanks to the type of clients we have. Most are very professional, just not very computer oriented.

Author: Andrew
Message: There are still people having trouble with handling computers nowadays? Other than old people.

Author: kite552
Message: Sadly, there is. I believe it is due to people live in the mobile age now, they are not used to sitting in front of a computer. They expect everything to be how it is on their cell phone.

Author: Andrew
Message: Somehow I'm imagining them touching their screen and wondering why it doesn't react...

Author: kite552
Message: Well funny story about that, I was just at the local computer store earlier. I felt so dumb, I was trying to demo the new macbook and I was used to my 2-in-1 at work so I was touching the screen.

Author: Andrew
Message: Well, to be fair there definitely are quite a lot of screens that have touch recognition now, even on desktops, so it's understandable. Still feels quite ridiculous though yes.

Author: kite552
Message: Very true, but I can see that the desktop might not go away, but it does feel like it is going to be replaced with more mobile like operating systems. iOS, Android, etc as we move forward.

Author: Andrew
Message: Probably. There will always be cases where you'll need a keyboard and a mouse though. Even if it's not for gaming.

Author: kite552
Message: Very true, I am sure. I am just speaking for the commercial market, where your average consumer buys and uses.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah that's probably true. We'll have to see what the future holds for that.

Author: kite552
Message: Very true, but I am sure the on the Enterprise side we have a few more years before it will change in that market.

Author: Moderator
Message: Time is up!

Author: Moderator
Message: Which actor do you think you've been talking to (This is not your final answer)

Author: kite552
Message: human

Author: Moderator
Message: Alright. The next conversation is about to start. Andrew will begin, then you'll have 15 minutes again after your answer.

Author: Andrew
Message: Hello!

Author: kite552
Message: Hello again.

Author: Andrew
Message: How are you doing?

Author: kite552
Message: I am doing alright, just relaxing and drinking some dr pepper.

Author: Andrew
Message: Oh nice! Enjoying your day?

Author: kite552
Message: It is going alright, just working on my computer.

Author: Andrew
Message: You relax while working? Sounds productive!

Author: kite552
Message: Well I find working on my own projects to be relaxing.

Author: Andrew
Message: True. I usually don't really consider it to be work if it's not at least a bit annoying. But I can see your point.

Author: kite552
Message: Yeah, at work I have to deal with other people's problems, when I am at home I can do what I enjoy. I am the type of person who can not just sit around and do nothing all day.

Author: Andrew
Message: Yeah I'm like that too. If I do nothing I end up sleeping. Otherwise I always need to find something to do, whatever that is.

Author: kite552
Message: Yeah, but I was very excited. I been building this computer over the past 2 weeks. It is coming along nicely, just got a second hard drive for storing all my files. The OS is on a small SSD.

Author: Andrew
Message: I did that for my gaming computer. Well, very moderately. I only changed the RAM...

Author: kite552
Message: I don't see the big difference in the types of ram, gaming vs standard. It really is only minor speed boosts.

Author: Andrew
Message: It's mostly that I needed it for a specific program which loads many bitmaps at the same time.

Author: kite552
Message: Yeah, that is the big thing with me. I mean I guess it makes since if you like a hard core gamer or a creative professional.

Author: Andrew
Message: Neither of those. I study biology. But I like creating worlds, and the software I use to do that requires many bitmaps of height maps loaded at the same time.

Author: kite552
Message: Very cool, I have toyed with virtual worlds myself. I like OpenSimulator it is a great virtual world platform, and it is opensource too.

Author: Andrew
Message: I've never tried this. I use world machine.

Author: kite552
Message: hmm never heard of that one

Author: Andrew
Message: Now you have. It's great at calculating erosion for realistic landscapes.

Author: kite552
Message: Ah very cool, but how does that relate to your study of biology?

Author: Andrew
Message: It doesn't, it's a hobby.

Message: first conversation I think was human
